intro: Schoenoxiphium ecklonii, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained conditions.
